)

Function: rtp_create_session_era_recv Description: Create the session structure for an RTP/RTCP session for era_recv environment. Parameters:

Parameters:
[in] src_addr - sessions src address to use for transmitting packets.
[in] p_cname - name
[in] era_dest_addr - destination address of primary session
[in] recv_rtcp_port - Client port on which RTCP packets are recvd. May be zero to disable RTCP reception.
[in] send_rtcp_port - Server port to which RTCP packets are sent. May be zero to disable RTCP transmission.
[in] fbt_ip_addr - ip address of feedback target
[in] rtcp_bw_cfg - ptr to RTCP bandwidth config info
[in] rtcp_xr_cfg - ptr to RTCP XR config info
[in] orig_source_addr - Original primary stream's source address.
[in] orig_source_port - Original primary stream's source port.
[in] sock_buf_depth - The rx socket buffer depth to be used.
[in] rtcp_dscp_value - DSCP value to use for RTCP packets sent
[in] rtcp_rsize - Reduced size RTCP setting for this session
[in] parent_chan - Pointer to parent channel.
Returns:
pointer to rtp_era_recv_t session that is allocated, or NULL on failure.

boolean rtp_era_send_to_rtcp_socket ( rtp_era_recv_t *  p_session,
in_addr_t  remote_addr,
in_port_t  remote_port,
char *  buf,
uint16_t  len 
)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Inject a RTCP packet into the primary RTCP socket.

Parameters:
[in] p_session Pointer to the primary session.
[in] remote_addr IP address to which the packet is sent.
[in] remote_port UDP port to which the packet is sent.
[in] buf Pointer to the packet contents.
[in] len Length of the contents.
[out] boolean Returns true if the packet was successfully enQd in the socket. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

in_addr_t  fbt_ip_addr,
uint16_t  send_rtcp_port 
)

Function: rtp_update_session_era_recv Description: Updates the session structure for an RTP/RTCP session for era_recv environment. Parameters:

Parameters:
[in] p_era_recv session to be updated
[in] fbt_ip_addr ip address of feedback target
[in] send_rtcp_port server port to which RTCP packets are sent.
[out] boolean TRUE upon successful update, FALSE upon failure
